thread.title: Bond yields edge lower on rand | Markets
thread.title_full: Bond yields edge lower on rand | Markets | BDlive

author: Andries Mahlangu
title: Bond yields edge lower on rand | Markets
text:
Picture: THINKSTOCK Related articles Rand stronger in late trade following US rate decision JSE takes breather after strong run Gold hits two-week high as Fed rate decision weighs on dollar THE South African bond market maintained a positive tone in late trade on Friday in line with an improved rand.
The yield on the R186 benchmark dipped to its lowest level in three weeks as the rand firmed briefly through R13.20 to the dollar.
But Sasfin Securities head of fixed-income dealing Ashley Dickinson cautioned that the market rally could prove temporary.
"We are likely to revisit the weaker prevailing growth story and could see yields rising from current levels," Mr Dickinson said.
"Risks from Asia, specifically China, could still cause some headwinds for broader emerging markets although much of that may already be in the price."
At 3.45pm the benchmark R186 bond was bid at 8.330% and offered at 8.320% from a previous close of 8.480%.
The middle-dated R207 was bid at 7.860% and offered at 7.835% from a previous close of 8.015%.
The rand was at 13.2182 to the dollar in late trade, having gained more than 2% this week.
